original_definition: 'reactive power reserve' means the reactive power which is available for maintaining voltage;
generated_definition: 'reactive power reserve' means a power reserve that can be quickly activated to compensate for changes in active and reactive power loads, ensuring operational security limits are not violated during contingencies.

Article 18: active andreactive power reserves are sufficient to withstand contingencies from thecontingency listdefined in accordance with Article 33 without violatingoperational security limits;
active and reactive power reserves are sufficient to withstand contingencies from the contingency list defined in accordance with Article 33 without violating operational security limits;
